intro: Xolisma pseudotinensis, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. Xolisma pseudotinensis is often found in sandy soils and is well-suited to thrive in harsh desert conditions.
